translation: przeciwstawny, sprzeczny [formal; exactly the opposite of someone or something or of each other]
sentence: The idea that science is antithetical to the arts is wrong.

translation: grzebień [a strip of plastic, wood, or metal with a row of long, narrow parts along one side, which is used to arrange or hold the hair]
sentence: Combs have been used from ancient times by women to hold and fix their hair.

translation: dziedziniec [an area of flat ground outside that is partly or completely surrounded by the walls of a building]
sentence: Entrance to the apartment building is through a central courtyard.

translation: zaniechać, odstąpić [to stop doing something, especially something that someone else does not want you to do]
sentence: The soldiers have been ordered to desist from firing their guns.

translation: wrodzony [(of a quality) which you are born with, or which is present naturally]
sentence: Her dance expresses the innate beauty of the human spirit.

translation: pionek [any one of the eight least valuable pieces in the game of chess]
sentence: The refugees are pawns in an international political dispute.

translation: grzechotnik [a poisonous snake found in southern parts of the US that, when annoyed, produces a loud noise by shaking its tail]
sentence: A huge rattlesnake lay coiled on the blanket.

translation: główna ulica, arteria [formal; a main road for public use or a passage through somewhere]
sentence: The property was located at the intersection of two busy thoroughfares.

translation: pod stopami [under your feet; on the ground where you are walking]
sentence: The grass was cool and pleasant underfoot. I was nearly trampled underfoot by the crowd of people rushing for the door.

translation: szaty liturgiczne [the special clothes worn by priests during church ceremonies]
sentence: His meals were always ready, his clothes clean and pressed, and his vestments for the Sunday service were immaculate.
